column4: if someody have an clue about why this ( http://authors.aspalliance.com/aylar/ViewPasteCode.aspx?PasteCodeID=3980 ) doesn't give the wanted result, I'll be thankfull
it does not work for me either. the manual says "time -f" should work, but it does not. Time sees it as a program to run :(
it seems that time  has a bug with arguments in Hoary. Every argument is treated as a program to run :(
i added a bug about it to bugzilla.
